newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Shell's Wavin seals Czech, French buys.
newsitem.headline: Shell's Wavin seals Czech, French buys.

text.p: Unlisted Dutch plastics maker Wavin BV said on Friday it had agreed to take over full ownership of Czech plastic pipes maker Dancco and was also buying French water systems firm Climasol.
Wavin, 50 percent owned by Royal Dutch/Shell, said in April it was in talks about acquisitions in these regions.
Wavin has held 49 percent of Dancco since 1992 and has now agreed with the Czech Gas Company (CPP) to aquire the remaining 51 percent, the company said.
Dancco produces gas and water pipes for the Czech and Slovak market and employs 60 people. No financial details were given.
Wavin intends to merge Dancco with its existing Czech sales and distribution business for PVC waste pipes, the company said.

Climasol produces hot and cold water systems for the building sector, primarily for floor heating. It had 1996 turnover of 12 million guilders and employs 15 people, Wavin said. -- Amsterdam newsroom +31 20 504 5000, Fax +31 20 504 5040
